model_summary: A logistic fairness model where responders compare the offered split to the fair share (based on token contribution). The latent utility is a linear function of the fairness discrepancy with two simple learnable parameters (an intercept and a sensitivity term). A sigmoid transformation converts the latent utility into a continuous prediction of acceptance.

A logistic model where the probability of accepting a proposal is determined by a baseline bias and the fairness difference between the offered share and the fair share (calculated from tokens and combined earnings). Two learnable parameters (beta0 and beta1) with finite bounds control the intercept and sensitivity to fairness, ensuring manageable covariance while predicting a continuous acceptance probability.
